text: <@U1QTD4ZNU|somii1.01> has joined the channel
Hello all
i am finding some difficulties in seeting up node.js api using swagger for chaincode
can anyone please help me out with these steps
<https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/API/CoreAPI.md#nodejs-application>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: <@U1QTD4ZNU>: just reviewed that, and I think I may see your problem… can you be a bit more specific as to what problem you are observing?
Thanks <@U0KM61BCP>

<@U1QTD4ZNU>: I have created a helper to get you swaggerized … I need to add some documentation but you can try it out if you’d like. I would welcome the feedback. I’ll contribute it to Hyperledger soon as I get it mostly finished
<https://github.com/christo4ferris/fabric-swagger>

attachments.title: christo4ferris/fabric-swagger
attachments.text: fabric-swagger - Simplify Swaggerizing the Hyperledger Fabric

text: basically, you need to start a peer process and then run the ‘runme.sh’ script. It will install what you need and launch a web server and open a browser window to Swagger UI. Then enter ‘rest_api.json’ and hit ‘Explore’ button
Hey <@U0KM61BCP> ! Does this take care of the CORS?
it runs with CORS, yes
Cool!
fetch the latest, I just fixed a bug
Thanks
This needs swagger service installed and running locally, right?
<@U1ENXTQRL>: no, it installs it and any dependencies for you
I wrote this so that if you aren’t actually developing the fabric but maybe just running the docker images, that you can still interact with the node via swagger
Sounds good, has it been tested on Windows?
<@U0P2GSA8Z> tested on Windoze and there was a tweak needed which I have pushed to my repo
should work
the one gotcha is that the peer will probably need to run on another port because of conflict with UPnP (5000) which means that the rest_api.json needs to reflect the appropriate port number
<@U1ENXTQRL> Beware that I use cygwin. I have no idea what that would be like without cygwin
But of course I have no idea how one can live on Windows without cygwin! ;-)
I have a Unix background.
great thanks <@U0KM61BCP>
